description: Related to, and perhaps derived from, Middle Dutch speauter. Possibly related to pewter.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) zinc, often in blocks or ingot form.
(uncountable, countable) Zinc alloyed with another metal (especially copper), used as a solder.
(countable) An objet d'art made from zinc.

verbs.description: spelter (third-person singular simple present spelters, present participle speltering, simple past and past participle speltered)

entries.meaning: To combine copper and metallic zinc to form an alloy.
